solution_line_template: Traveling at {biff_speed} yards per minute, Biff can travel {race_distance} yards in {race_distance}/{biff_speed}=<<{race_distance}/{biff_speed}={time_biff_finishes}>>{time_biff_finishes} minutes.

In {time_biff_finishes} minutes, traveling at {kenneth_speed} yards per minute, Kenneth can travel {time_biff_finishes}*{kenneth_speed}=<<{time_biff_finishes}*{kenneth_speed}={distance_kenneth_travels}>>{distance_kenneth_travels} yards.

Thus, Kenneth will be {distance_kenneth_travels}-{race_distance}=<<{distance_kenneth_travels}-{race_distance}={yards_past_finish_line}>>{yards_past_finish_line} yards past the finish line when Biff crosses the finish line.
